articles.description: Rusty Young, who co-founded the band Poco, died of a heart attack at his home in Davisville, Miss., on Wednesday. Over its 50-plus-year history, Young was the only original band member to stay with the country-rock group.

Rusty Young, who co-founded the band Poco, has died, Fox News can confirm. He was 75.
Young died of a heart attack at his home in Davisville, Miss., on Wednesday, a rep told Variety.
